mosinstall.description:
JoomlaWorks "Simple Image Rotator" Module v1.1

Usage Instuctions

Setting up the "Simple Image Rotator" Module

The "Simple Image Rotator" module offers a simple (yet eye-candy) image rotating mechanism (or slideshow in plain English) for the Joomla! masses! It is an alternative to Flash image rotation scripts, which are sometimes difficult to implement and heavy regarding filesize (not to mention the EOLAS -click to activate- issues in Internet Explorer!). The module borrows the nice effects from such scripts, but uses javascript to auto-"magically" rotate images from any given folder!

It's actually a simple to use module, which adds to the overall look of your Joomla! website.

See the module in action in our exclusive DEMO SITE.

So how do we setup the module? First of all, create a folder anywhere in your Joomla site. Prefer to do this under images/stories, so that you want stumble upon file permission issues! Create for example a folder named headers inside images/stories. Now add the full path to this newly created folder in the parameters below. The path would be images/stories/headers.

Adjust the speed and timeout of the rotation as well as the target width and height of your images and that's it! Publish the module in an existing position and enjoy! You can also choose to display images in sequence or randomly, add a link to some URL, e.g. a link to your products page (useful if you're running an e-shop) and even choose between a light or dark background scheme to load alternative "loading" icons and therefore match your template better. Just remember you can only use one instance of the module per page. This means you cannot publish the module twice on the same page.

It doesn't get any simpler!

If you still have questions or want to provide feedback on the module, please visit our official Support Forum.

Using the "Simple Image Rotator" with Joomla's built in Banner Component

We've added a nice little feature for everyone to switch the module in "banner" mode. That way you can use the module to rotate all published banners, defined inside Joomla's Banner Component. See the last 2 settings below for this option.

param.name: moduleclass_sfx
param.label: Module Class Suffix
param.description: A suffix to be applied to the css class of the module (table.moduletable). This allows individual module styling.

param.name: imagefolder
param.label: Image Folder path
param.description: Set here the path to the folder containing the images to be displayed. The module will scan this folder and display images automatically!

param.name: display
param.label: Display order
param.description: Should the images display in sequence or randomly?

param.name: transition
param.label: Rotation speed
param.description: Set here the rotation speed (in 1/100th seconds) between images. 100 means 1 second.

param.name: delay
param.label: Rotation timeout
param.description: Set here the rotation timeout (in miliseconds) for every image. 1000 means 1 second.

param.name: width
param.label: Image (header) width
param.description: Set here the target width of all images in pixels.

param.name: height
param.label: Image (header) height
param.description: Set here the target width of all images in pixels.

param.name: forceresize
param.label: Force image resize (if wider)
param.description: Should we force all images exceeding the given width above to resize, using CSS?.

param.name: enablelink
param.label: Enable link to images?
param.description: Should the images have a universal link pointing to a single URL? If you choose no, then the next parameter is disabled, obviously!

param.name: link
param.label: Link to URL
param.description: Insert here a link to a URL that users will be redirected to when they click on the 'Simple Image Rotator'. Enter '#' (without the quotes) for same page.

param.name: target
param.label: Where should the above link open?
param.description: Choose whether the 'master' link will open in a new or in the same window.

param.name: linktitle
param.label: Link title
param.description: Insert here the link title which will be shown to the visitor when they hover their mouse ver the images. Do not use single or double quotes or the HTML will break.

param.name: darkbg
param.label: Display 'loading icon' for...
param.description: Display different loading icon per template color scheme, white or dark.

param.name: useforbanners
param.label: Should the Rotator be used to display banners from the Banner Component?
param.description: This option will retrieve all published banners and display them.

param.name: bannerfolder
param.label: Banner folder
param.description: Leave as is if you haven't changed the default banners location.
